intro: Asclepias uvirensis, commonly known as the Congo milkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central and Eastern Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces showy, yellowish-orange flowers with a distinctive horn-shaped structure at the center. Its milky sap contains latex, which is a common feature in the genus Asclepias. This species plays an important role in supporting local ecosystems, particularly as a host plant for certain butterfly species.
